Row.Text: So, it is true. There are strangers in the forest. Who are you, and why have you come to Palmares?
I haven't seen your face before. I am Zumbi, king of the quilombos. Are you here seeking trade?
I see that contact with you has become inevitable. I am Zumbi, who rules the quilombo of Palmares.
With that, the quilombos are lost. We must once again seek a home beyond your cruel reach.
You may pursue us for the rest of time. We will not be bound by your shackles.
You've returned.
Yes?
What do you need from us?
No.
You are overestimating your leverage.
Palmares is fortunate to welcome you.
You join us once again. What do you need?
It is unwise for you to come here.
Is this a war? Your armies are so meek, I'm unsure if they even wish to fight.
I have heard whispers of dissent among your men. If they seek a free existence, they are welcome to join us.
You and I are effective allies. I have a great respect for your honor and diplomacy.
I hear there are others that resist your brutal reign. Perhaps they would make good partners.
I believe you will defeat your oppressors, and live in freedom once again.
If you are here to capture us, to put us in chains; you have made a mistake.
You have filled the forests with your soldiers. If you do not withdraw, my soldiers will join them there.
I have no interest in your supposed claims. Do not encroach upon our borders.
Palmares seeks peace... at a comfortable distance. You must respect that.
Stop your expansion. Any more, and I will burn the empire your gold has bought you.
Land disputes do not interest me. The quilombolas will go where they please.
Your army is vast and well-disciplined. If you wish, send them to me for training in the art of capoeira.
Your people live in great comfort and wealth. They are fortunate to have your stewardship.
You have few cities. In Palmares, even the mocambos are thriving economies.
I hope your men are skilled capoeiristas. With so few soldiers, you will not be able to defend yourself otherwise.
You are a brutal warmonger, and your people live in chains. Judgement will soon greet you.
Palmares must seek allies. We'll be stronger as partners than as foes.
I have grown to trust in you and your people. Palmares will be better for having you as an ally.
There is a sense among the quilombolas that our interests are aligned with yours. Do you agree?
The quilombos must remain hidden and independent, until a time when the world forces itself upon us.
Do not attempt to involve Palmares in your affairs.
Many quilombolas that have fled {1_CivName} speak of their terrible atrocities. Join me in voicing our disgust.
My people live in freedom. Yours live in chains.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Stay far away from the forests of the quilombos.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
This does not concern me.
I am uninterested in your opinion.
{1_CivName} is a friend and trading partner of the quilombos. I'm please to see your relations are strong.
Many of my people once suffered under {1_CivName} tyrrany. Choose your friends carefully.
{1_CivName} supports Palmares in our struggle for freedom and independence. We stand with them in this matter.
{1_CivName} threatens to chain us all. We'll stand together against them.
I do not grant my trust easily, but I trust you in this matter. We have now sought good relations with {1_CivName}.
I will heed your warning about {1_CivName}. No empire will be allowed to chain Palmares.
Empires like {1_CivName} and yourself want to take us back into shackles. You underestimate us.
{1_CivName} and Palmares will stand together in the face of your brutality.
The jungle is thick and our warriors are fast. You are walking into your grave.
A fight here will not go in your favor.
If you do not stop your expansion, I will stop it for you.
I do not appreciate your expansion into our territory.
I see your attempts to buy our lands with gold. It would be more straightforward if I simply took that gold from you.
Gold can bring you a great many things. My land is not one of them.
Every day I welcome new quilombolas, fleeing from {1_PlayerName:textkey}'s brutal reign. We must fight this evil at its source.
One day, the brutal master {1_PlayerName:textkey} will come to enslave both our peoples. If we stop them now, our children will be forever grateful.
{1_PlayerName:textkey} is a brutal slave-master and a tyrant. They must be stopped, and they must be stopped by us.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} seeks only to live in peace and freedom. You will let them be.
No.
I have no intention of living near you.
We fled our cruel masters to find this home. We stay.
I couldn't help but notice how pathetic you are. And when I realized it I couldn't help but share.
Ah, it's always nice to see my favorite city-state again.
I'm really getting tired of seeing your face. My hope is that one day you'll just go away or something.
Ah, it's you. My apologies. Sometimes I get you mixed up with the barbarians I have to swat from time to time.
I thought you might like to know that your army is a little on the weak side. Better watch your back.
With an army so weak it's a surprise your empire hasn't succumb to a barbarian invasion.
Our words are backed with nuclear weapons!
It's a shame there are some leaders in this world who have their fun by picking on the weak. Don't you agree?
I can hear your people wailing in sorrow all the way over in my empire. If you don't do something soon they might just pack up and find a real civilization to live in.
With people so unhappy it's a shock to me that they'd keep you around as their leader.
It's come to my attention that your empire appears to be quite puny. Did you forget to expand your borders or are you just having a little trouble with that?
Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. If you beg a little I might give you a hand. Okay, actually I won't.
What a sad sight... your empire is so uncultured. What do your citizens do all day, beat rocks together?
Rumor has it that your culture is so laughable that even the barbarians are shying away from your lands.
The mocambos are famed for their textiles and weaves. I wish to make an exchange of luxury goods.
Few quilombolas venture beyond home. For those that do, I seek protection.
Take me for a fool at your own risk.
Tough negotiations will make us both stronger.
Our people produce fine goods. I expect you to honor us with an equal exchange.
So you have come to shackle us at last.
I will protect every quilombola from the cruelty of your whip.
You have turned away from us. So be it.
Capoeira is no mere dance. I will show you its true purpose in battle.
It is time I broke the chains of your oppression.
I have decided to free your people and have them join us in the quilombos.
I will not share a border with a cruel master such as yourself.
We will protect our home with the lives we have reclaimed.
If you think I will not fight for it, you are mistaken.
There can be no peace until the quilombos are safe.
I will not negotiate with cruel empires.
I will seize the whip from your hand. Then we will have peace.
Our people are now eating your feijoada and performing your strange martial dances. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
We are glad to see that your people are eating feijoada and practicing capoeira. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
